ai:cl.c: Provides support for viewport definitions within a vector tree.

ai:a.c: Free all child objects contained by the viewport.
Move the position of the viewport by delta X, Y.
ai:a.p: ERR acMove(*Object, DOUBLE DeltaX, DOUBLE DeltaY, DOUBLE DeltaZ)

ai:i.c: The number of units to move along the X axis.
The number of units to move along the Y axis.
The number of units to move along the Z axis.

ai:a.c: Move the position of the viewport to a fixed point.
ai:a.p: ERR acMoveToPoint(*Object, DOUBLE X, DOUBLE Y, DOUBLE Z, MTF Flags)

ai:i.c: The new X position to move the object to.
The new Y position to move the object to.
The new Z position to move the object to.
Set the relevant MTF flag for each provided parameter.

ai:a.c: Reposition and resize a viewport to a fixed size.
ai:a.p: ERR acRedimension(*Object, DOUBLE X, DOUBLE Y, DOUBLE Z, DOUBLE Width, DOUBLE Height, DOUBLE Depth)

ai:i.c: The new X position to apply to the target object.
The new Y position to apply to the target object.
The new Z position to apply to the target object.
The new width of the target object.
The new height of the target object.
The new depth of the target object.

ai:a.c: Resize a viewport to a fixed size.
ai:a.p: ERR acResize(*Object, DOUBLE Width, DOUBLE Height, DOUBLE Depth)

ai:i.c: The new width of the object.
The new height of the object.
The new depth of the object.

ai:f.c: The horizontal position of the viewport, relative to (0, 0).
The vertical position of the viewport, relative to (0, 0).
Flags that affect the aspect ratio of vectors within the viewport.
Returns the bitmap buffer that the viewport is using.
Set to true if the viewport should buffer its content.
Dimension flags define whether individual dimension fields contain fixed or scaled values.
Receiver for drag requests originating from the viewport.
The height of the viewport's target area.
Clipping options for the viewport's boundary.
Clipping options for the viewport's boundary on the x axis.
Clipping options for the viewport's boundary on the y axis.
The height of the viewport's source area.
The width of the viewport's source area.
The horizontal position of the viewport's source area.
The vertical position of the viewport's source area.
The width of the viewport's target area.
Positions the viewport on the x-axis.
Positions the viewport on the x-axis.
Positions the viewport on the y-axis.
Positions the viewport on the y-axis.
